|stockos = Linux;;; |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |exp_hdmi_num = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, unpopulated,, 3.3V TTL,, (38400 8N1) |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router |defaultssid_regex = ^SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router$ |default_ch = |manuf = E-TOP |manuf_model = BR380n |manuf_rev = v3 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = 04/2010 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192SE;RTL8192SE, A1J97A1 GA12; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== There appears to be a v1 and v2 of this device. I don't know what the difference between versions is.. "EPMBBR380NBXX3XX", "BR380n_MB_V30", and a date code of '''1030''' is silkscreened on the board of the particular unit populating this entry. The default SSID of the wireless interface is '''SAPIDO_All_Broadband_Router'''. The default Universal Repeater Mode SSID is '''ESSID_SAPIDO_RB-1232'''. The default SSIDs for multi-SSID mode are '''Multiple_APX''', where X is 1 through 4. ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The pinout would appear to be the following... 
T1
[3.3] (TxD) (RxD) (GND)
{{/Serial info}} ==Notes== ===Included PSU(s)=== The included power adapter for at least some units is a '''Channel Well Technology''' CAP008051. {{hasPowerSupply |brand = Channel Well Technology |model = CAP008051 |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.25 |input_c=AC |input_hz=47-63 |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |output_v=5 |output_a=1.5 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |style=medium, horiz. |countrymanuf = China |e_level=5 }} [[Category:English Documentation]]
